Key Match Events: Kohli’s masterclass takes India home in a tense finish.
India looked down and out at 31 for 4 in the seventh over.
India needed 54 runs off the final four overs.
Kohli’s calculation to take Rauf on in the penultimate over gave India a fighting chance with 16 needed off the final over.
Nawaz suffered a serious meltdown of no-balls and wides to gift India the victory.
Kohli ends up with an unbeaten 82 off 53, which will surely go down as the greatest T20 innings he has played to date.
India pulled off a miraculous win at the MCG, finishing at 160-6 in 20 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma: 'The best innings Kohli has played for India.'
Rohit Sharma: 'We always wanted to make sure we stayed in the game as long as possible.'
Rohit Sharma: 'That partnership [Hardik and Kohli] changed the game for us.'
Babar Azam: 'We started well in our bowling, but then all credit to Hardik and Kohli.'
Babar Azam: 'We can take a lot of positives from the way Iftikhar and Masood played, and how we finished the innings.'
Virat Kohli: 'I have no idea how that happened.'
Virat Kohli: 'Hardik kept telling me to believe and to stay till the end.'

Virat Kohli: 'Till today I said Mohali was my best T20 innings. Then I got 82 off 52 and today I got 82 off 53. Both are just as special but I would count this one higher due to the magnitude of the game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan have now won only two of their last eight matches against India.
India will now head to Sydney, where they play the Netherlands on Thursday.
Pakistan will fly to Perth to regroup and get their campaign back on track. They face Zimbabwe on Thursday.
